statement.tex: \text{Evaluate the following definite integral }\\ \int_{0}^{\pi/4}\tan x\, dx

step.tex: \text{Yes. $\tan x$ is defined and continuous in }\left[0,\dfrac{\pi}{4}\right]
\text{No. $\tan x$ is not continuous at }x =\dfrac{\pi}{2}\text{ and}\\ \text{therefore not defined and continuous in }\left[0,\dfrac{\pi}{4}\right]
step.reason: \text{It is important to check for continuity in the}\\ \text{interval because area under a curve in that}\\ \text{interval only makes sense if the curve is}\\ \text{defined and continuous at all points in it.}\\ \text{For e.g.}\int_{\pi/4}^{3\pi/4}\tan x\, dx \text{ does not make sense} \\ \text{because $\tan x$ is not defined at }x=\dfrac{\pi}{2}\text{ and}\\ \frac{\pi}{2}\in \left[\frac{\pi}{4}, \frac{3\pi}{4}\right]
